quotes.quote: If it's dirty, it's not funny, but if it's funny, it's not dirty
A dirty exterior is a great enemy to beauty of all descriptions.
Of all the paths you take in life, make sure a few of them are dirt.
Even dirt glitters when the sun is shining upon it.
Under the pavement the dirt is dreaming of grass.
Dirt makes a man look masculine. Let your hair blow in the wind, and all that. It's OK. All you have to do is look neat when you have to look neat.
We have the same dirt under our shoes as they do.
Dirt has been shrewdly termed "misplaced material".
Grow from the dirt that they left you in.
Gold's father is dirt, yet it regards itself as noble.
Six feet of dirt make all men equal.
Delay and dirt are the realities of the most rewarding travel.
Airing one's dirty linen never makes for a masterpiece.
Dirt is not dirt, but only something in the wrong place.
No matter how dirty your past is, your future is still spotless.
Play in the dirt because life is too short to always have a clean fingernails.
People are like dirt. They can either nourish you and help you grow as a person or they can stunt your growth and make you wilt and die.
When you mix dirt with water, the dirt doesn't get clean. The water just gets dirty.
Where there is dirt there is system. Dirt is the byproduct of a systematic ordering and classification of matter.
It is when we notice the dirt that God is most present in us; it is the very sign of His presence.
Dirt used to be a badge of honor. Dirt used to look like work. But we've scrubbed the dirt off the face of work and consequently we've created this suspicion of anything that's too dirty.
Don't call the world dirty because you forgot to clean your glasses.
Money is a necessity; so is dirt.
Even the most beautiful rose has been the through dirt.
It is the dirt within men's hearts that is most offensive; the filth you cannot see.
When you throw dirt, you lose ground.
It is almost impossible to throw dirt on someone without getting a little on yourself
Dirt is only matter out of place; and what is a blot on the escutcheon of the Common Law may be a jewel in the crown of the Social Republic.
It is not dirt but the fear of dirt which is the sign of man's degeneration, and it is dangerous to judge a man's physical and moral sanity by outside standards.
